unnormalised: Hey Quorans, someone asked about when Diwali usually falls. It's a pretty common question, and the answer is a bit tricky, 'cause it's based on the Hindu lunar calendar.
normalised: Hey Quorans, someone asked about when Diwali usually falls. It's a pretty common question, and the answer is a bit tricky, 'cause it's based on the Hindu lunar calendar.

unnormalised: Generally, Diwali is celebrated around Oct-Nov. The main day, Lakshmi Puja, is on the darkest, new moon night of the Kartik month. That's why the exact date changes every yr. In 2023, it was on 12/11. The next one should be around 31/10/2024 or 1/11/2024, but best to check a proper Hindu calendar for the confirmed date.
normalised: Generally, Diwali is celebrated around October November. The main day, Lakshmi Puja, is on the darkest, new moon night of the Kartik month. That's why the exact date changes every year. In two thousand twenty three, it was on twelfth November. The next one should be around thirty first October two thousand and twenty four or first November two thousand and twenty four, but best to check a proper Hindu calendar for the confirmed date.

unnormalised: Don't forget, Diwali isn't just one day, bhai! There are actually 5 days of festivities, starting with Dhanteras usually 2 days before the main day, followed by Naraka Chaturdashi (Choti Diwali), Lakshmi Puja, Govardhan Puja, and finally Bhai Dooj, usually 2 days later. So, block off almost a week around late Oct/ early Nov!
